intro: Juno heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan juniper, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its dense, needle-like foliage and small, dark blue berries. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Juno heldreichii is known for its slow growth and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
